alert.note: Alert for Travis; Williamson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 21 at 5:59PM CDT until March 21 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: The National Weather Service in Austin San Antonio has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southeastern Williamson County in south central Texas... Northeastern Travis County in south central Texas... * Until 645 PM CDT. * At 559 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms capable of producing both tornadoes and extensive straight line wind damage were located over Round Rock, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations impacted include... Austin, Round Rock, Georgetown, Pflugerville, Taylor, Granger, Windemere, Hutto, Thrall, Granger Dam, Coupland, Rices Crossing, Laneport, Hoxie, Wells Branch, Waterloo, Hare, Jonah, Noack and Sandoval. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
